title: Broken Compatibility with Cray CN16 Systems
body:
Identified issues with semi-recent (post spack v0.14.2) changes to how spack detects compilers and environment variables on Cray XC40 machines running CN16 . Specifically tested on LANL's Trinitite and Trinity with NERSC's Cori (CN17) used as a control. Regardless of spec and compilers.yaml, Spack maps Cray's compiler wrappers to the system compiler of ```gcc@4.8.5``` 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack compiler find
$  spack install comd~mpi%gcc@9.2.0
```

### Error Message

On XC40 with haswell+knl compute nodes running CN16  (Trinitite)
```console
$ spack compiler find
$  spack install comd~mpi%gcc@9.2.0
==> 19586: Installing comd
(...)
  >> 114    cmdLineParser.c:1:0: error: bad value (haswell) for -mtune= switch
  >> 115    mycommand.c:1:0: error: bad value (haswell) for -march= switch
```

And On XC40 with haswell+knl compute nodes running CN17 (Cori) installation succeeds

### Information on your system

Error manifests with 

```
 spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1312-3347ef2de
* **Python:** 3.4.10
* **Platform:** cray-sles12-haswell
```

Able to have successful building (barring usual issues with cray platforms) using release ```v0.14.2``` under which debug does not have a report command. Have not further bisected commits in interim yet.

### Additional information

- [x ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x ] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
